name: 2.Data Prep and Feature Engineering
content:
Data Description and Preparation

Data Description (from dataset):

The dataset contains customer and loan attributes used to assess credit risk.

  • Demographic Features:
  • Gender, Married, Dependents, Education, Self_Employed.
  • Financial Features:
  • ApplicantIncome, CoapplicantIncome, LoanAmount, Loan_Amount_Term, Credit_History.
  • Loan Features:
  • Property_Area, Loan_Status (target variable).
  • Target Variable:
  • Loan_Status: Y = Loan Approved (non-default), N = Loan Rejected/Default-prone.

Data Preparation Steps:

  1. Data Cleaning:
  • Handle missing values in LoanAmount, Loan_Amount_Term, and Credit_History.
  • Treat outliers in ApplicantIncome and LoanAmount.

Feature Engineering:

  • Create Debt-to-Income ratio = (LoanAmount) / (ApplicantIncome + CoapplicantIncome).
  • Bin continuous variables (e.g., income groups, loan amount categories).
  • Encode categorical features (one-hot or label encoding).

Balancing Data:

  • Address class imbalance between defaults and non-defaults using SMOTE or class-weighted models.

Data Transformation:

  • Scale numerical features for models sensitive to magnitude (e.g., Logistic Regression, Neural Nets).
